ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] bah numbers
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Rokenn is really the one to answer this as he s done tests with it (I haven t run into him in town while he s free to test this).  But I m pretty sure it
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 27 Mar 2000, Sylly Songsynger wrote:
>
> So, my question is...
>
> DDD, for example, calculates to 33 dmg for my level (48 still) and I presume
> that this means 33 for 3 'ticks' (correct me if that is wrong: DoT lasts 3
> ticks). Now is that a potential max damage number in that you can get
> partial resists? Or does that mean if the song sticks (not resisted on the
> first tick) it will do 33 * 3 for a total of 99? Or is there a possibility
> of partial resists?

Rokenn is really the one to answer this as he's done tests
with it (I haven't run into him in town while he's free to
test this). But I'm pretty sure it does last 3 ticks (deducts
hp 3 times if you only pulse the song once). The listed
damage is done per tick. If it's not resisted, the DoT is on
for the duration, meaning 3*33 for a total of 99.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
